newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-MCCOIST SEES RANGERS THROUGH IN CUP TIE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MCCOIST SEES RANGERS THROUGH IN CUP TIE.

text.p: Substitute striker Ally McCoist put holders Rangers through to the third round of the Scottish League Cup on Thursday with the 62nd minute goal in a 1-0 away win over first division Hamilton.
McCoist, who came on for injured Norwegian Staale Stensaas shortly before the interval, grabbed the goal after a poorly directed header by Hamilton captain Chris Hillcoat fell his way.
The striker also had the ball in the net two minutes before half time but the goal was disallowed.
Hamilton had their chances against the league champions, who fielded a distinctly second-string side, hitting the bar through a Stevie Thomson chip in the second half.
